x:Key="ShapeSize">373,185</av:Size></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><uaba:DsfCommentActivity DisplayName="HINT: Quick Variable Input" sap:VirtualizedContainerService.HintSize="373,185" Text="Grid tools have a cool function that lets you quickly add lots of 
fields. Click the icon in the top right of the tool. You can 
split the content of the Variable List field (we paste into this field 
from documentation / Excel, SQL etc) and provide each new 
variable with a prefix (recordset(). is handy) or suffix. Also, you 
can append to fields you have already typed into the tool or 
replace what is already there. Lastly, the tool will repeat the 
settings of the line that has the focus when you clicked the icon, 
so make sure you set that correctly first!"><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><x:Boolean x:Key="IsExpanded">True</x:Boolean></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState></uaba:DsfCommentActivity></FlowStep><x:Reference>__ReferenceID2</x:Reference><FlowStep><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><av:Point x:Key="ShapeLocation">498,223</av:Point><av:Size x:Key="ShapeSize">376,95</av:Size><av:PointCollection x:Key="ConnectorLocation">498,270.5 468,270.5 468,260 430,260</av:PointCollection></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><uaba:DsfCommentActivity DisplayName="HINT: File Processing" sap:VirtualizedContainerService.HintSize="376,95" Text="Great for processing Files into variables that you can work with.
If your file has headers and footers, first split it into header, body, 
footer and then process each of those seperatley as needed."><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><x:Boolean x:Key="IsExpanded">True</x:Boolean></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState></uaba:DsfCommentActivity><FlowStep.Next><x:Reference>__ReferenceID2</x:Reference></FlowStep.Next></FlowStep><x:Reference>__ReferenceID3</x:Reference><FlowStep><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><av:Point x:Key="ShapeLocation">499,453</av:Point><av:Size x:Key="ShapeSize">505,95</av:Size><av:PointCollection x:Key="ConnectorLocation">499,500.5 469,500.5 469,492 429,492</av:PointCollection></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><uaba:DsfCommentActivity DisplayName="CSV" sap:VirtualizedContainerService.HintSize="505,95" Text="Everything you declare here will be repeated 
untill the end of the processing. Use (*) in your recordsets to populate the entire entry into your variables. Effectively you are describing a row in the file and how it is made up."><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><x:Boolean x:Key="IsExpanded">True</x:Boolean></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState></uaba:DsfCommentActivity><FlowStep.Next><x:Reference>__ReferenceID0</x:Reference></FlowStep.Next></FlowStep><FlowStep><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><av:Point x:Key="ShapeLocation">497.5,582.5</av:Point><av:Size x:Key="ShapeSize">343,80</av:Size><av:PointCollection x:Key="ConnectorLocation">497.5,622.5 467.5,622.5 467.5,625 429,625</av:PointCollection></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><uaba:DsfCommentActivity DisplayName="Relevant info" sap:VirtualizedContainerService.HintSize="343,80" Text="You dont have to put the data into a variable if you dont 
need it, simply skip that definition and move onto the next."><sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState><scg:Dictionary x:TypeArguments="x:String, x:Object"><x:Boolean x:Key="IsExpanded">True</x:Boolean></scg:Dictionary></sap:WorkflowViewStateService.ViewState></uaba:DsfCommentActivity><FlowStep.Next><x:Reference>__ReferenceID3</x:Reference></FlowStep.Next></FlowStep></Flowchart></Activity>
